qa_pair.question: Use fullWebFetch to get the complete markdown content from https://httpbin.org/html and then tell me how many headings (H1, H2, H3, etc.) are present in the page content.
qa_pair.answer: Count the markdown headings in the fetched content. The response should be a number.

qa_pair.question: Use simpleWebFetch to fetch the content from https://example.com. What is the main heading (H1) of the page?
qa_pair.answer: Extract the main H1 heading from the fetched content. The answer should be the exact text of the heading.

qa_pair.question: Use saveWebFetch to save the content from https://httpbin.org/html to the 'test/' directory. What file path was returned?
qa_pair.answer: Provide the exact file path shown in the response. The path should include 'test/' directory and a .md filename.

qa_pair.question: Use saveWebFetch with a custom filename to save https://example.com as 'docs/custom-name.md'. What file path and size were returned?
qa_pair.answer: Provide the file path and file size from the response. The path should be 'docs/custom-name.md' with a file size in bytes.

qa_pair.question: Use fullWebFetch with custom options to fetch https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/posts/1 with maxChars set to 500. What is the 'title' field value from the JSON data?
qa_pair.answer: The JSON response from JSONPlaceholder should contain a 'title' field. Provide the exact text of that field value.

qa_pair.question: Use crawlWebFetch to crawl pages matching the pattern 'https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/*' and save them to 'crawl/' directory. How many pages were successfully saved?
qa_pair.answer: Provide the number of successfully saved pages from the crawl result. The answer should be a count of the pages that were saved.

qa_pair.question: Use fullWebFetch to get the content from https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf (note: this may redirect or be unavailable). If successful, what is the page title? If it fails, what error message is returned?
qa_pair.answer: Either provide the page title if successful, or the specific error message if the fetch fails. The answer should reflect the actual result.

qa_pair.question: Use saveWebFetch to save https://example.com to a file. Verify that the saved file contains YAML frontmatter with 'url', 'title', and 'fetchTime' fields. Does the file have these metadata fields?
qa_pair.answer: Confirm that the saved file includes YAML frontmatter with the three required fields. The answer should be 'yes' or 'no' with explanation.

qa_pair.question: Use fullWebFetch with the default settings to fetch https://httpstat.us/200 and tell me what HTTP status code information is displayed on the page.
qa_pair.answer: Provide the HTTP status information shown on httpstat.us/200. The answer should be the specific text displayed on the page.

qa_pair.question: Test error handling by attempting to use simpleWebFetch with an invalid URL format like "not-a-valid-url". What error message does the server return?
qa_pair.answer: Provide the exact error message returned when an invalid URL is used. The error message should match what the server returns.

qa_pair.question: Test path validation by attempting to use saveWebFetch with an absolute path like '/etc/passwd'. What error message does the server return?
qa_pair.answer: Provide the exact error message returned when an absolute path is used. The error should mention that only relative paths are allowed.

qa_pair.question: Use simpleWebFetch to fetch the content from https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com. What is the main description or title shown on the page?
qa_pair.answer: Extract the main heading or description from the JSONPlaceholder page. The answer should be the exact text from the fetched content.
